text: We recommended that, in general, any or pharmaceutical preparation which has an action on the central nervous system and is liable to produce physical or psychological deterioration should be confined to supply on prescription and that an independent expert body should be responsible for advising which substances should be so controlled. As an interim and urgent measure, the Secretary of State for the Home Department, on the recommendation of the Poisons Board, has made Rules under which certain substances having an action on the central nervous system are included in a new list of substances which may be sold by retail only on the prescription of a duly qualified medical practitioner, registered dentist, registered veterinary surgeon or registered veterinary practitioner.
